channel.title: STA 199: Intro to Data Science on STA 199
channel.description: Recent content in STA 199: Intro to Data Science on STA 199

item.description: Note: This schedule may be updated as the semester progresses. Due dates for the exams and project will not be changed. Date Lesson Slides Reading Lab AE HW Exam Project Week 01 Tu, Aug 27 Welcome to Data Science Th, Aug 29 Meet the Toolkit Fr, Aug 30 Lab 01 UNIT 1 Collecting, wrangling, & visualizing data Week 02 Tu, Sep 3 Fundamentals of data & data visualization Th, Sep 5 Tidy data & data wrangling Fr, Sep 6 Lab 02 Week 03 Tu, Sep 10 Effective data visualization, Part 1 Th, Sep 12 Effective data visualization, Part 2 Fr, Sep 13 Lab 03 Week 04 Tu, Sep 17 Confounding variables & Simpson's paradox Th, Sep 19 Coding style + data types + recoding variables Fr, Sep 20 Lab 04 Week 05 Tu, Sep 24 Recap Th, Sep 26 Functions and automation Fr, Sep 27 Lab 05 Week 06 Tu, Oct 1 Data ethics Exam 01 assigned Th, Oct 3 TBD Fr, Oct 4 Work on Exam 01 Exam 01 due Week 07 Tu, Oct 8 NO CLASS - Fall Break UNIT 2 Modeling relationships between variables Th, Oct 10 Language of models Fr, Oct 11 Project Lab Week 08 Tu, Oct 15 Formalizing linear models Th, Oct 17 Modeling nonlinear relationships + multiple predictors Fr, Oct 18 Lab 06 Week 09 Tu, Oct 22 Multiple linear regression + model selection Th, Oct 24 Prediction + model validation Fr, Oct 25 Lab 07 UNIT 3 Making rigorous conclusions Week 10 Tu, Oct 29 Estimation via bootstrapping Th, Oct 31 Estimation via bootstrapping Fr, Nov 1 Lab 08 Week 11 Tu, Nov 5 Hypothesis testing via simulation methods, Part 1 Th, Nov 7 Hypothesis testing via simulation methods, Part 2 Fr, Nov 8 Lab 09 Week 12 Tu, Nov 12 Inference via Central Limit Theorem, Part 1 Th, Nov 14 Inference via Central Limit Theorem, Part 2 Fr, Nov 15 Project Lab Week 13 Tu, Nov 19 Inference for regression Exam 02 assigned Th, Nov 21 Inference for regression Fr, Nov 22 Work on Exam Exam 02 due Week 14 Tu, Nov 26 Text analysis Th, Nov 28 NO CLASS - Thanksgiving Break Fr, Nov 29 NO LAB - Thanksgiving Break UNIT 4 Looking forward Week 15 Tu, Dec 3 Interactive data visualization and reporting, Part 1 Th, Dec 5 Interactive data visualization and reporting, Part 2 Fr, Dec 6 Lab 10 Final Exam Period Sa, Dec 14 Project presentations

item.title: Course Policies
item.description: Activities & Assessments The following activities and assessments will help you successfully achieve the course learning objectives. By experiencing the course content in different ways, you will not only gain a better understanding of data science, but you will also get experiences that can guide you as you apply what you've learned in future academic and professional projects. Homework In homework, you will apply what you've learned during lecture and lab to complete data analysis tasks.
